p: Sensory evaluation was carried out in the sensory laboratory of the Department of Vegetables and Medicinal Plants, WULS-SGGW. Quantitative descriptive analysis (QDA) was used. The evaluation was determined on the fresh herb of both subspecies, collected in the first cut (at the beginning of blooming). Attributes of its taste and odor were selected and estimated. In order to select attributes, ‘brainstorming’ sessions were done by an expert panel consisting of a minimum of 10 assessors. Evaluation was performed in two independent sessions. The description of method has already been given by Kosakowska et al. [ 18].
